channel.title: [Delphi]Reading line by line
channel.description:
How do I read a file line by line? I give an example of what I mean: something.txt contains the following:
lol o man dis is line 1 lol o man dis is line 2 lol o man dis is line 3 lol o man dis is line 4
What I want the app to do is when you press a button, an edit.text becomes line 1 of the text. Then when you press the button again it becomes line 2 of the text etc.... How do I do that? Thanks in advance.

item.title: [Delphi]Reading line by line
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

This is how I do it, maby it’s not the best way but it works. I know a google search would be better, but I did a search and it was very unclear, so asking here would be the next step. But yea, that didn’t help either. But I screwed around abit and came up with this:

procedure TForm1.Button2Click(Sender: TObject); var j : integer; begin AssignFile(txt, OpenDialog1.FileName ) ; Reset(txt) ; while not EOF(Txt) do l := l +1; edit1.Text:= Memo1.lines[l]; Memo2.Lines.Add (edit2.Text); Edit2.Clear; label3.Caption:='Current line: ' + inttostr(l + 1); j:= (-1 + Memo1.Lines.Count); label4.Caption:='Total lines: ' + inttostr(j); CloseFile(txt); end;

item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Technically the best way would be to use the default file functions, but if you want to do it fast and easy you could use a TStringList. The LoadFromFile will load the contents of the file into the memory and then you can just retrieve the lines either all at once or one by one from it…
